description: From Latin circumcīsiō, from circumcīdō (“cut around”), from circum (“about, around; through”) + caedō (“cut, hew”).
Conceptually preceded by the Greek term περιτομή ("peritome")

entries.meaning: The surgical removal of the foreskin of the penis.
examples: So ſay I , did the Covenant of circumciſion, in that he that was circumciſed was bound to keep the whole Law Gal 5. 3.

entries.meaning: The surgical removal of the clitoral hood of the clitoris; female circumcision.
(often proscribed) The surgical removal of the clitoris; clitoridectomy, usually referred to as female genital mutilation.
